hackathon-requirements: You can submit between 5pm and 5:30pm on Saturday. Please begin this process on Devpost before 5pm! Late submissions will not be accepted.
hackathon-rules:
Submissions judged only on content developed during hackathon period: Friday 6:30pm to Saturday 5pm. A note on packages: while we encourage the use of packages to save time, in judging, greater empahsis will be placed on original code, especially for visualizations. 
 All code must be submitted to a repository on Github to verify time of edits.
All teams must deliver a 3:30 minute presentation, followed by 1 mins of Q&A from the judges and audience. 
 All submissions must be related to the Hackathon theme areas. 
:
External hardware is allowed (e.g. Wifi lighbulbs, arduinos, etc.), but projects will be judged  only on code or developments which occur during the Hackathon. 
In the event of any dispute, the decision of Hackathon organizers will be final.
All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at our hackathon are required to agree with the following 
. Organisers will enforce this code throughout the event. We expect cooperation from all participants to ensure a safe environment for everybody.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Samsung Odyssey VR Headset, sponsored by Microsoft

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How well does this submission address a theme of the Hackathon? (25%)
How creative, innovative, interesting, and unique is the submission?
How well is the idea executed by the team, and how much has been achieved from a technical standpoint?
To what extent will the submission make a positive impact in its theme area? How scalable is the submission, and does the team have a plan for next steps if they were to continue the project?
See the Hackathon Slide Deck on the front page of the Github for more detail

hackathon-description-header: Creating innovative solutions to the biggest challenges in energy and climate.
